Material used.Description: Binding of Cu²⁺ to wild-type and mutant alpha-synuclein proteins was measured under physiological conditions.

Readout description.Result Description: A30P mutation showed lower binding constants (Kd) compared to wild-type protein.
A53T mutation exhibited altered binding stoichiometry and lower Kd values compared to wild-type.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent experiments were performed with wild-type and mutant proteins.

Technical replicates.Description: Each measurement was repeated in triplicate.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type alpha-synuclein was used as a positive control for binding.

Basic negative control.Description: Protein-free buffer was used as a negative control for binding.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: ANOVA was used to compare binding constants across groups.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Cu²⁺ binding affinity within 10% of wild-type Kd values.

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Cu²⁺ binding affinity reduced by >20% compared to wild-type Kd values.
